summary: This is a November 11, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, producing Amazon records previously held by the Southern District of Florida. The letter explains the materials are subject to a protective order and are being produced out of an abundance of caution.

events.title: Production of Amazon Records
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York produces Amazon records to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, materials originally from the Southern District of Florida's files.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential materials.

events.title: Prior Production from Florida FBI File
events.description: In the fall of 2020, the government previously produced materials from the Florida FBI file to the defense.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York produced Amazon records to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on November 11, 2021.
The materials (control numbers SDNY_GM_02771981 through SDNY_GM_02771983) were originally from files maintained by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.
The production is governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and the materials are marked 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER'.
The government states these Amazon records were likely previously produced from the Florida FBI file in the fall of 2020, but are being produced again out of an abundance of caution.
The document indicates ongoing discovery obligations in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
